question: 両者
sourceMnemonic: When you have <kanji>both</kanji> <kanji>someone</kanji>s, you have <vocabulary>both people</vocabulary>. You'll notice over time that <ja>者</ja> is often used to indicate a person or type of person, so keep that in mind for future words as well!
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
